story.text: WASHINGTON AeroVironment Inc., which supplies unmanned aircraft systems to the U.S. Department of Defense, on Wednesday said it is planning an initial public offering of 6.7 million shares. For between $14 and $16 per share, the company plans to issue 4.5 million shares and selling stockholders will sell another 2.2 million shares, according to an amended offering document filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. The underwriters, led by Goldman Sachs & Co., will have the option to buy another 1 million shares to cover over-allotments. The Monrovia, California-based company is seeking a Nasdaq listing under the symbol "AVAV."
story.title: aerovironment sets ipo at 6 . 7 million shares
